content:
HttpServerUtilityBase Class

Definition

Serves as the base class for classes that provide helper methods for processing Web requests.

In this Article

public abstract class HttpServerUtilityBase
Inheritance
System.Object
HttpServerUtilityBase

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpServerUtilityBase class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the HttpServerUtility class. The HttpServerUtilityBase class enables you to create derived classes that are like the HttpServerUtility class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.

The HttpServerUtilityWrapper class derives from the HttpServerUtilityBase class. The HttpServerUtilityWrapper class serves as a wrapper for the HttpServerUtility class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the HttpServerUtilityWrapper class to call members of the HttpServerUtility object.

Constructors

HttpServerUtilityBase()

Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

protected HttpServerUtilityBase ();

Properties

MachineName

When overridden in a derived class, gets the server's computer name.

public virtual string MachineName { get; }
Value
String

The name of the server computer.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

ScriptTimeout

When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the request time-out value in seconds.

public virtual int ScriptTimeout { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The time-out value for requests.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

NotImplementedException

Always.

The new object.

NotImplementedException

When overridden in a derived class, creates a server instance of a COM object that is identified by the object's class identifier (CLSID).

Execute(String)

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process.

public virtual void Execute (string path);
path
String

The URL of the handler to execute.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Execute(String,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process and specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

public virtual void Execute (string path, bool preserveForm);
path
String

The URL of the handler to execute.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Execute(String,TextWriter)

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current process, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the executed handler.

public virtual void Execute (string path, System.IO.TextWriter writer);
path
String

The URL of the handler to execute.

writer
TextWriter

An object to capture the output.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Remarks

The writer parameter is passed by reference to the Execute method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the writer object. For an example, see Execute.

Execute(String,TextWriter,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, executes the handler for the specified virtual path in the context of the current request, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the page and a value that indicates whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

public virtual void Execute (string path, System.IO.TextWriter writer, bool preserveForm);
path
String

The URL of the handler to execute.

writer
TextWriter

The object to capture the output.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Remarks

The writer parameter is passed by reference to the Execute method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the writer object. For an example, see Execute.

Execute(IHttpHandler,TextWriter,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, executes the specified handler in the context of the current process, using a TextWriter instance to capture output from the executed handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

public virtual void Execute (System.Web.IHttpHandler handler, System.IO.TextWriter writer, bool preserveForm);
handler
IHttpHandler

The HTTP handler that implements the interface to transfer the current request to.

writer
TextWriter

The object to capture the output.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Remarks

The writer parameter is passed by reference to the Execute method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the writer object. For an example, see Execute.

String

The HTML string to decode.

output
TextWriter

The stream to contain the decoded string.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Remarks

The output parameter is passed by reference to the HtmlDecode method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the output object. For an example, see HtmlDecode.

The string to encode.

output
TextWriter

The stream to contain the encoded string.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Remarks

The output parameter is passed by reference to the HtmlEncode method. To retrieve the output from the handler after the method completes, you use the properties and methods of the output object. For an example, see HtmlEncode.

MapPath(String)

When overridden in a derived class, returns the physical file path that corresponds to the specified virtual path on the Web server.

Transfer(String)

When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a page or handler that is specified with a URL.

path
String

The URL of the page or handler to execute.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Transfer(String,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current page and starts execution of a different page or handler by using the specified URL and a value that specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

public virtual void Transfer (string path, bool preserveForm);
path
String

The URL of the page or handler to execute.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

Transfer(IHttpHandler,Boolean)

When overridden in a derived class, terminates execution of the current process and starts execution of a new request, using a custom HTTP handler and a value that specifies whether to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequestBase.Form* collections.

IHttpHandler

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

NotImplementedException

Always.

String

The URL of the page or handler to execute.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

NotImplementedException

Always.

TransferRequest(String,Boolean,String,NameValueCollection)

When overridden in a derived class, asynchronously executes the endpoint at the specified URL by using the specified HTTP method and headers.

public virtual void TransferRequest (string path, bool preserveForm, string method, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection headers);
path
String

The URL of the page or handler to execute.

preserveForm
Boolean

true to preserve the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections; false to clear the stem.Web.HttpRequest.QueryString* and stem.Web.HttpRequest.Form* collections.

method
String

The HTTP method (GET, POST, and so on) to use for the new request. If null, the HTTP method of the original request is used.

headers
NameValueCollection

A collection of request headers for the new request.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

UrlTokenDecode(String)

When overridden in a derived class, decodes a URL string token into an equivalent byte array by using base64-encoded digits.

public virtual byte[] UrlTokenDecode (string input);
input
String

The URL string token to decode.

Returns
Byte[]

The byte array that contains the decoded URL token.

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.

UrlTokenEncode(Byte[])

When overridden in a derived class, encodes a byte array into an equivalent string representation by using base64 digits, which makes it usable for transmission on the URL.

public virtual string UrlTokenEncode (byte[] input);
input
Byte[]

The byte array to encode.

Returns
String

The string that contains the encoded array if the length of input is greater than 1; otherwise, an empty string ("")

Exceptions
NotImplementedException

Always.
